section.title: Question words: one-word questions
section.sectiontitle: We use What, Where, When, How, Which and Why to make questions.
section.sectiontitle2: We use What if there are many possible answers and Which if there are only a few possible answers.
section.text3: Joe DiMaggio was a famous sportsman.
section.text4: I understand Japanese, Chinese and English.

section.title: Question words: two-word (compound) questions
section.sectiontitle: We can make compound questions with What and Which.
section.text1a: What kind/sort/type of food do you like? Italian.
section.text2a: Which one do you like the best? That one.
section.sectiontitle2: We can make compound questions with How.
section.text3a: How often do you have English classes? Three times a week.
section.text4a: How long are your lessons? One and a half hours.
